Oh, nice, a quest! I kill demons for free, so I'll totally do it for money. Piece of cake.

What, really? I'm an adventurer and a protagonist, not a dumbass NPC shopkeeper. I'm either gonna die covered in the blood of a horde of monsters, or I'm never gonna die. Retirement's not an option.

Yeah, yeah, I've heard it all before. This is me already channeling my anger towards a productive goal. It's just that my goal happens to be crushing you into a smear on the floor. Metaphorically. In poker. For the XP.
Armchair therapist, much? I've already got professional help in channeling my anger towards a productive goal. My productive goal here is to beat your ass and loot your XP to get better at poker.
Wait, is this not strip poker? Where's the money, then? What are you talking about, Monika?
What? Monika, what are you talking about? How could this game be anything other than strip poker? I read the rules and everything.
I prefer "adventurer", but sure, that's close enough. I'm not trying to do this quickly because I'm busy, though, it's because I want to make sure I use my XP farming time efficiently. You get it.
My preferred job title is adventurer, but bounty hunter works. I'm not in a hurry because I'm busy, though, I just want to max my XP farming efficiency. You get it.
All of them, as far as I know. I mean, I've never met a monster who didn't exist. Why? You trying to get an interview with one of them or something?

Oh, every monster I've ever heard about is real. Zombies, demons, physical incarnations of fear, parasitic brain-controlling fungi, evil alternate reality selves, everything. Why? You have a favorite you wanted to meet?
You're gonna need to be more specific than that, Miki. I've said a bunch of stuff. There should be a dialogue log around here somewhere if you need to check it...
Not the first time I've been asked that, and it won't be the last. I'll need you to be more specific to give a real answer, though. Maybe take a look back through the dialogue log?
...Huh. I guess we do, if you look at it like that. I mean, there's definitely plenty of people I hurt, at least. And not all of them deserved it, really...
I don't know if I'd have thought about it that way, but sure, I guess so. I have hurt a lot of people, and at least some of them didn't totally deserve it...

Salil... There was a while where I was looking after him, yeah. It's a big responsibility. And if anything goes wrong, even if there's nothing you could have done to stop it, it makes you feel like shit.

Salil is... how do I put this? I was looking after him for a while, yeah. It's not easy. It takes a lot, and sometimes, no matter what you do, things will happen that you can't protect your sibling from, and it makes you feel like shit.
...Huh? An Adept? No, I'm The Slayer. I'm not one of those wimpy mages.
Do I look like an Adept to you? I mean, I guess I've got the hood... But no, I'm The Slayer. I'm not a dumb caster.
Of course it is! Every adventurer of my level has fully enchanted gear, and a bunch of sets to swap out. Why? Do you make enchantments?
What kind of adventurer doesn't have multiple full sets of enchanted gear? Of course it's all enchanted. Why? Do you enchant magic items?

Ha! My tree's easy! There's me and Salil at the bottom, and then there's my Mom, and Grandma, and a long line of other incredible Slayers!
And the other side of the tree can get fucked. That part's not important.

Really? My family tree's super easy. I guess that's because my Mom comes from a lineage of incredible Slayers who all have their names embedded in history for their great power.
And that's all! No other important parts of the tree!
I... What? I'm attractive! I can kill all sorts of things! I'm a killing machine, which is the sexiest thing anyone can be!
What!? I'm sexy! Look! I'm in a room with other people who want to see me get naked! And I can kill people! That's the best proof of all!

I'm fun! I'm just not trying to be fun right this second. I've got XP to farm, and the slower this game goes, the less efficient my farming is.

Hm... Well, I've been actively slaying and adventuring for a bit under a decade, but I've known I was going to be a Slayer since way before then. It's a family tradition! My mother was a slayer, and so was my grandmother!

It's been... well, I'm twenty-two now, so... nearly a decade since I entered my first dungeon, but I was training for a couple of years before that. I've always known I was going to be a Slayer and follow in my mother and grandmother's footsteps.

Eyeing them up? You should be. They're top-tier loot, made from demon-leather and celestial emeralds, enchanted to give immunity to charm effects, bonus to sneak attack damage, and boosts to crit chance and damage. Got them from a dragon's hoard after I solo'd the encounter.

Jealous? I can't blame you. These are top-tier loot, from when I solo'd a dragon. Demon-leather bracers with celestial emeralds, so they grant immunity to charm effects, extra sneak attack damage, and increased crit chance and damage.
What!? I am not-- No, no, you're right, I'm falling back into bad habits. Sorry. I want to be fast, but that doesn't mean I have to be angry when things are slower than I'd like. Deep breaths.

What the fuck are you-- Ah, fuck, I'm doing it again, aren't I? Ugh. Old habit I'm trying to break, sorry. Just because I want things to go fast doesn't mean I have to get angry when things are slow. Deep breaths.
Oh, I wouldn't blame security. That's just my stealth skill in action. They could be looking specifically for me and still have let me in.
Eh, it's not really security's fault. I've got a crazy high stealth stat, that's all. They could have been told to look out for people with blue hair in red cloaks and still missed me.

...Something like that, yeah. I... was hurt, a long time ago, by a powerful monster. I've held a grudge against him since that day, when he destroyed my family. I want to keep other people safe from that, and the stronger I am, the more people I can keep safe.

It's... I was hurt, when I was much younger, by a powerful monster. The pain I went through... It left me with scars, and broke my family. I want to protect people from that same pain, and the stronger I am, the better I can do that.

Well, you have to be, when you come from a lineage of Slayers. Who knows when you'll encounter a monster?
Actually, I'm constantly surrounded by monsters. I mean a violent monster.
No, that's also really common. I mean a monster who specifically has sought me out to try to kill me because I'm the Slayer.

Well, yeah, that's how being the Slayer is. There's hostile monster encounters all over the place. I mean, monsters who want to specifically kill me, not just generally hostile monsters. Some of my best friends are generally hostile monsters.

Something... soft? About me? Uh... hm. Well, I... um... There's probably something soft about me, but... that's not a side of myself I'm very in touch with. There's a lot of gritty exterior. Can you... give an example? Ugh, sorry, that sounded dumb.

I... My soft side, huh? That's... hm. Uh... Well, there there probably is something about me that's soft, deep down, but the gritty exterior is really, really thick. I'm... not really in touch with my softer side. Like, at all. So... if you could give an example of where to start...? Ugh, sorry, that sounded super dumb...
Are you staring at me, Sucrose? Admiring my gear? You should. They're all ultra-rare drops from my dungeon crawls.
Don't worry about staring, Sucrose, I get it. My gear's the best you've seen, right? All ultra-rare drops from dungeon bosses. This is better than money can buy.

Oh, that's easy. It just takes practice. In a life-or-death battle, if you doubt yourself, you lose. Win some of those, and you prove you deserve whatever confidence you might have been faking before.

Oh, that's simple. Just start faking it. When you're in a fight for your life, if you doubt yourself, you die. Survive a few of those, and even if your confidence used to be fake, you've got the skills to back up the real stuff.

Slaying some zombies? With you? Yes! Sure! I'd love to... Lee?
Ugh, no, I wanted to try the nickname thing, but that was just weird. Zombies still sounds good, though!

After this? Just the two of us? Sure! Yes! I'd love to... Lee?
Ugh. That did not work. I wanted to try the nickname thing too, and it just... yeah. I'm still up for some Slaying, though!
A reward? Well, I was planning to win anyway, so this is just an extra bonus. Not that there's any chance of me not winning, but what would happen then? Would I have to give you some kind of prize?
Like there's any chance I wouldn't win. Sure, you're on. Oh, I guess I should ask... will I owe you something if I don't win? Or is it just a bonus if I do?

Of course I do. It would be wrong for a monster-slaying badass like me to look any other way.
...While I'm not at summer camp, at least.
Of course. No self-respecting monster-slaying badass would show up without her armor. This isn't summer camp, after all.
Oh, yeah, I've got a little apartment in Monstropolis. Nothing fancy, but I can keep all my extra loot there, and it's nice to have a place to crash after a day of classes and dungeoning.

Ha, yeah. I don't know I'd really call it a proper base, but I've got a little apartment in Monstropolis. Adventuring pays the bills, and it's good to have a place to put extra loot, and crash after dungeons or class.
What, are you afraid I'm going to pull out some unholy daggers and attack? I might be violent, but I don't attack angels unprompted.
Really? An angel, worrying about me attacking him? I might be violent, but I won't kill an angel unless you try to kill me first.

Ugh, you really are an angel, aren't you? Yeah, the material plane is pretty different to Heaven or Elysium or Nirvana or where-the-fuck-ever it is you come from, Pit, and Monstropolis is a pretty extreme example.
You can really tell you're an angel, you know that, Pit? The world outside of Heaven or Elysium or Nirvana or where-the-fuck-ever it is you come from isn't nice and sweet. Monstropolis especially.
Oh, absolutely. I mean, I do fetch quests and escort mission too, but I love a good dungeon.
That's the adventuring life. Well, that and fetch quests, but dungeons are the part I love.
What? Yes! Obviously! It... makes me more aerodynamic! And it's important for my stats, too!
It's very important! Obviously! For aerodynamics! And other stats too!

Sure, lore for lore sounds like a pretty reasonable trade. I got my gear from the toughest enemies I've fought, then refined it into the the forms that best suited me. You've got stories about dragons and monsters and stuff where you come from, right?
Well... There was this one threesome with a demon and a vampire... I don't know if I can top that, but I'm not against trying.
The strangest... I mean, there was this one threesome with a demon and a vampire. I don't know how I'd top that... But I'd be willing to try.

...I am supposed to try to stop using violence as an answer to everything... How does a Puyo battle work?

Yeah, slaying pays well, but it's just a hobby that's also my life purpose right now. I've still got to go to classes and get my diploma from Spooky High too.
You managed to solo a dragon? That's pretty impressive, especially for a squishy type like you. The rewards are totally worth it, though. Some of my best gear is from dragon hoards.
Gotta say, I didn't expect a squishy type like you to be able to solo a dragon. That's pretty impressive. The rewards are worth it, though, right? A bunch of my best gear came from dragon hoards.
Hey, it's not my fault if you can't keep up. You're supposed to be a genius alchemist, right? You don't need someone like me to spell out something that basic, do you?
Aw, is the genius alchemist stumped by something that basic? Come on, you're supposed to be one of the greatest minds in your world, right? Surely you can keep up with me.
Ha! I know what you mean. The only people I know bold enough to match me are literal hellspawn.
Oh, I know exactly what you mean. The only people I know who are bold enough to match up to me are literal demons from hell.
Oh... Yeah, I... I guess it's time for that, huh? That's... fine. I'm just a little lower on layers than I'd like...
I guess I was kinda hoping I could win enough to keep this on... but I'm short on other layers, so...
Card games? Sure, I dabble. I've got a high-tier competitive PokeMan deck, and I destroy at Battle Tarot, but I don't do TCGs as much as RPGs, dating sims, shooters... video games in general, really.

I can handle myself in a TCG, sure. My Battle Tarot game is unmatched in Spooky High, and I can wipe the floor with anyone with my PokeMan deck, but I don't love TCGs like video games. I'd always prefer a shooter, RPG, or dating sim.

My eyes are so green because of my tragic backstory. I'd tell you about it, but our support level isn't high enough. Also, you're a robot, so I think you could probably buy a cosmetic to get the same effect, so you really shouldn't be jealous.

If our support level was higher, I'd tell you about my tragic backstory, which explains why my eyes are green, but we just don't have the points for that. Also, a robot like you could probably buy eye cosmetics to look like mine, so being jealous is kinda weird.

Besides, these are my regular clothes. They look good, and they're great protection.

A recording? What, so I could play back someone telling me kind, life-affirming things that make me feel warm and fuzzy inside? Sounds dumb. I'd never do something like that.
...unless it's a collectible. Because then I'd have to.

...unless it was a collectible. Then I guess I'd have to.
Wait, you sell save slots? Holy shit, why didn't you say anything earlier!? I've got so much gold for a valuable service like that!
Hold up, you sell save slots? Why didn't you say anything about that before!? I've got tons of gold to throw your way!
Are you suggesting an XP share? Ew. No, you hold onto that. I'll just beat you in a fight and loot it from you later. That way, I get the XP from a fight and the potion, too.
Ugh, XP sharing? Do I look like a noob? No, you keep that. I'll just beat you up and loot it from you later. That way, I get the full points from the potion and some extra from the fight.

Your methods seemed to produce... reasonable results. It wouldn't hurt to know how you were doing it, I suppose.
Ha! I am the type to start a fight, and you're right, you would die, but it wouldn't be worth the XP. Better for me to use you to train my poker skill.

I might start a fight here if there was a combat encounter worth the XP, but you? You're collateral damage at the most, and I'd be lucky to get two digits worth of XP from wasting you. Nah, better to use you to train my poker skill.

Hidden blades? Pfft, if I was using those, I'd deserve roasting. There's no XP in bypassing fights! If I did that, I'd just end up underlevelled when it came to the boss. No, I fight monsters head-on, like a real Slayer!
Ha! Can you imagine, a Slayer using hidden blades? I'd deserve to be roasted if I was! If you bypass all the fights, you'll just be underlevelled for the boss. That's why I face my prey head-on!

You have no idea how pent up I am. Therapy is supposed to help me find "constructive" and "safe" ways to vent, but there's a big difference between that and just letting loose, you know?

Well, I prefer "efficient" or "results-oriented", but sure, "sadist" isn't wrong. What kind of slayer would I be if I wasn't willing to inflict vast amounts of pain on my enemies?

I... guess I don't mind having them. Especially if they're hot. I mean, I'm there for the fighting, but if a cute princess wants to tear my clothes off, I'm not about to stop her...

...Besides, my references are cool.

But for things that don't have heads to crossbow, I've got some taunt skills I can slot.

Elemental mastery? That's a big thing in Teyvat, right? I don't have one of those "vision" things, I just have a bunch of weapons to swap between depending on what's most effective.

Oh, yeah, I explore ancient ruins all the time. That's one of the stock archetypes of dungeon. They're usually pretty low on loot, though. All the pottery still drops rupees if you break it, but other than that, it's mostly just tablets full of lore and the occasional legendary weapon.

Ancient ruins are one of the most common types of dungeon, so yeah, I've explored plenty of them. Lootwise, if they don't have a legendary weapon, they're usually just full of boring lore tablets and pottery that drops rupees if you break it.
My biggest kill? Hm... It's not like I've measured them, but I'd guess it was either an ancient dragon or a kraken. They're about as big and nasty as monsters come.
My biggest kill? Well, I didn't measure them or anything, but I'd guess it was either a kraken or an ancient dragon. Both huge, nasty monsters.
I... W-Well... Yeah. I used to be scared of lots of things, before I was a badass killing machine. There's nothing that can scare me now, though.
I... used to be afraid of plenty of things. But I used that fear as fuel to become a badass, so now there's nothing for me to be afraid of.
...Whatever. I get it. Not letting people get close means they can't hurt you. I used to do the same thing. It's hard not to fall back into the habit. Just don't do it again.

...Safer to be a bitch than risk being hurt by being vulnerable. I get it. I relied on that kind of shit a lot. It's hard to stop once you've found something that works. Don't try it again and we can forget it happened.
...Did your "side effect" make you think I'd take that as a compliment? Because if so, I'd stop taking its advice ASAP.
Your "side effect" can't be all that good if it made you think saying that was a good idea.
You seriously think your "try-on" could outperform my best-in-slot gear? You really are as dumb as you look.
Oh please, just because it's fancy tech, you think your "try-on" can beat best-in-slot gear? I didn't think it was possible for you to be dumber than you looked, but you might just prove me wrong.
Ooh, hard call... Might be the bagel dungeon. Might be Noodles' Europe. Might be the localized post-apocalypse in the desert. Can you beat those?
Crazy's all pretty relative. I mean, Monstropolis is home to all kinds of monsters, but it works like any other city. Is that crazy or boring?
I'd say it makes you lazy and a cheater. Whatever it is, I'm sure it's a cheap gimmick that'll get you killed the moment someone figures out how to get around it.
I'd say that's the coward's way out, and any fight won using it isn't a real victory. If you rely on tech like that, you're gonna get your ass handed to you the moment someone figures out a loophole.

Well, they're all important, obviously, but forced choice... a strong weapon, I guess? Assuming you have enough mental strength to not cower in fear at the first sign of danger, a strong weapon kills everything before any of them can kill you.

Well, ideally you have all three, but if you can only have one... Assuming there's a baseline of mental strength that you can fight at all, a strong weapon is most important. If everyone else is dead, you don't have to worry about them hitting you.
Just what a girl likes to hear. Thanks so much, Jin. It's really important to me that I meet the standards of some asshole who worships rice crackers.
Oh, good. I was really worried my ass wouldn't be able to meet the high standards of the random asshole I just met who's in love with rice crackers.
Has anything I've done to~background.time~ made you think I'd agree to that? Go fuck yourself, Jin.
Do you really think I'd care about how you of all people rate my ass? Go fuck yourself, Jin.
Depends on how you define "always". I mean, I've worked with parties before in one-shot adventures, but I've never joined a guild or anything like that. You've got a party, right?

That depends on your definition of "always". I've never joined up with an official adventuring guild or permanent group, but I've partied up with people for tough challenges. You've got a long-term party, right?
About time you managed to hit me. It was funny watching you all flail around helplessly.
So much for getting a flawless victory...
Hmph, I guess this isn't going to make that much difference. I'm still wasting you all.
So what? You're all still losing. A loss or two won't change the final outcome.
Just because my victory won't be flawless doesn't mean it's going to be any less brutal.
So you're not all as helpless as you look, huh? Maybe this will actually be a challenge... maybe.
Oh great, rubber-banding. Everyone's favorite.
Oh, so you're learning to actually punish when I obviously slip up? About time.
I can still handle any fight like this, even if I've got some pieces missing. Can you say the same?
I might be winning, but every loss fills me with immense anger! Anger I will be talking about in therapy!
Ha! I'm still winning, and victory is worth more than any amount of dignity!
My clothes were just weighing me down! I'm more dangerous than ever!
I have to take off my sweet gear? Ugh, I hate games with reverse progression...
